analyzed: 'o ma dang chu 'dres pa ltar gcig tu gyur pa'i ngo bor bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa ;

analyzed: 'dus pa yis bsam 'dres pa yis //

analyzed: gang gang dbang po'i lam nyid ni //

analyzed: bdag nyid ngo bo mchod par bya //

analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

analyzed: mar dang sbrang rtsi dang / 'o ma dang 'dam bu ka ra la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma brtags pa gcig pu kho nas rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa //

original: dngos kun rang bzhin gang yin pa //
analyzed: dngos kun rang bzhin gang yin pa //

analyzed: dngos gcig rang bzhin de yin no //

analyzed: zhes so // gzhan yang gsungs pa /

analyzed: thabs dang shes rab stobs kyis ni //

original: mi bya ba ni 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: mi bya ba ni 'ga' yang med //

analyzed: ces pa'o // gsungs pa'i don kho na gsal bar gsungs pa / lto ba la sogs ye shes mes //

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: de la lto zhes pa ni khong pa'i nang ngo //

analyzed: de bas na bshang gci la sogs pa ni lha bshos mkhas pas shin tu 'gal lo zhes rtog pa ni mi bya'o //

analyzed: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid 'joms pa'i don nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de ltar yang sgyu 'phrul dra ba las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang sgyu 'phrul dra ba las gsungs pa /

analyzed: ji ltar mi gtsang nyid du gsungs /

analyzed: ye shes kyi me'i dbus su bsreg bya ba zhes pa ni sbyin sreg bya ba'o //

original: don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: me dang rlung gi bdun pa yis //

analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: de'i don ni bshad zin to //

analyzed: de'i dbus su gzung bar bya //

analyzed: da ni k'a li'i de bzhin nyid bshad par 'dod pas gsungs pa //

original: gdan la skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa'i slob dpon gyis phyag g-yas pas pus mo sa la btsugs pa'i slob ma'i thal mo la bzung nas bslab pa sbyin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdan la skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa'i slob dpon gyis phyag g-yas pas pus mo sa la btsugs pa'i slob ma'i thal mo la bzung nas bslab pa sbyin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The master, seated cross-legged on the seat, holds the palms of the disciple who has placed his knee on the ground with his right hand, and gives the precepts, which is the meaning of the words.🔽What are the words of the disciple who has placed his knee on the ground and joined his palms in supplication to the master?

original: slob dpon la sa la pus mo btsugs shing thal mo sbyar ba'i slob mas zhus pa'i tshig gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon la sa la pus mo btsugs shing thal mo sbyar ba'i slob mas zhus pa'i tshig gang yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: @45b sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun dang // zhes pa la sogs pa dang po bzung nas /
analyzed: @45b sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun dang // zhes pa la sogs pa dang po bzung nas /
translated: The Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, and so on, beginning with the first,

original: aom yo ga shuddha:sarba dharm'a:yo ga shuddho& ham zhes pa'i bar du ste /🔽de la / ma brgal ba rnams bdag gis bsgral //
analyzed: aom yo ga shuddha:sarba dharm'a:yo ga shuddho& ham zhes pa'i bar du ste / de la / ma brgal ba rnams bdag gis bsgral //
translated: up to Oṃ yogaśuddhaḥ sarvadharmāḥ yogaśuddho 'haṃ.

original: zhes pa ni srid pa'i rgya mtsho la lhung ba'i sems can yang dag pa'i rig pa dang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni srid pa'i rgya mtsho la lhung ba'i sems can yang dag pa'i rig pa dang mi ldan pas /
translated: Among them, I shall liberate those not liberated means that sentient beings who have fallen into the ocean of existence, not possessing right knowledge,

original: ngan song gsum ni ma bsgral zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song gsum ni ma bsgral zhes pa'o //
translated: are not liberated from the three lower realms.

original: de dag yang dag pa'i chos kyi don bstan pa dang / spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag yang dag pa'i chos kyi don bstan pa dang / spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug bzhin du /
translated: like Avalokitesvara,

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan 'gro ste /
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan 'gro ste /
translated: the hells and so on are the unfortunate realms.

original: chos ston zhing yang dag pa'i rig pa dang ldan par byas nas srid pa'i rgya mtsho las dbyung bar bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos ston zhing yang dag pa'i rig pa dang ldan par byas nas srid pa'i rgya mtsho las dbyung bar bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having taught the Dharma and made them possess right knowledge, they should be rescued from the ocean of existence. This is the meaning of the vow.

original: ma grol ba rnams bdag gis dgrol //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ma grol ba rnams bdag gis dgrol // zhes pa ni /
translated: I will liberate those not liberated.

original: ngan song nas yang byung na yang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa rnams kyis srid pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bcings pa las ma grol ba ni lha dang mi'o //
analyzed: ngan song nas yang byung na yang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa rnams kyis srid pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bcings pa las ma grol ba ni lha dang mi'o //
translated: Having emerged from the unfortunate realms, gods and humans are not liberated from the bondage of the attachment to existence and so on due to the grasping of I and mine.

original: de dag kyang chos thams cad bdag med pa'i don bstan nas 'dod chags kyi bcing ba dang / zhe sdang gi bcing ba dang / gti mug gi bcing ba las grol bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos thams cad bdag med pa'i don bstan nas 'dod chags kyi bcing ba dang / zhe sdang gi bcing ba dang / gti mug gi bcing ba las grol bar bya zhing /
translated: Having taught them the meaning of the selflessness of all phenomena, they should be liberated from the bondage of attachment, the bondage of aversion, and the bondage of delusion.

original: mya ngan las 'das par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: They should be brought to nirvana. This is the meaning of the vow.

original: de ltar rjes su brtse ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su brtse ba'i phyir //
translated: Thus, out of subsequent compassion,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de lta bu'i srid pa'i rgya mtsho la lhung ba'i ngan song gsum dang / mtho ris gnyis la byang chub kyi //
analyzed: de lta bu'i srid pa'i rgya mtsho la lhung ba'i ngan song gsum dang / mtho ris gnyis la byang chub kyi //
translated: In that way, in the three lower realms and the two higher realms that are fallen into the ocean of cyclic existence,

original: gsang pa dang / gsod du 'jug pa ma yin pa'i sgo nas gnod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gsang pa dang / gsod du 'jug pa ma yin pa'i sgo nas gnod par mi bya ste /
translated: one should not harm them by way of killing or causing them to be killed,

original: brtse zhing gdung bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: brtse zhing gdung bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: but should be loving and compassionate.

original: slob ma de dag la gdan la bzhugs pa'i slob dpon gyis slar lan btab pa ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob ma de dag la gdan la bzhugs pa'i slob dpon gyis slar lan btab pa ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: The master who is seated on the seat for the disciples, wishing to teach the reply, says:🔽The three types of physical,🔽and so forth up to:

original: lus kyi rnam pa gsum nyid dang // zhes pa la sogs pa nas ji ltar gsungs pa'i chos bstan zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /🔽de la / lus kyi rnam pa gsum nyid ni //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa gsum nyid dang // zhes pa la sogs pa nas ji ltar gsungs pa'i chos bstan zhes bya ba'i bar du ste / de la / lus kyi rnam pa gsum nyid ni //
translated: the Dharma that is taught.

original: zhes pa ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'o //
translated: The three types of physical are killing, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct.

original: ngag gi spyod pa rnam bzhi dang // zhes pa ni brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang tshig rtsub dang ; tshig brlang pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi spyod pa rnam bzhi dang // zhes pa ni brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang tshig rtsub dang ; tshig brlang pa'o //
translated: The four types of verbal conduct are lying, slander, harsh words, and frivolous speech.

original: yid kyis kyang ni rnam gsum ste //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yid kyis kyang ni rnam gsum ste // zhes pa ni /
translated: And the mind is threefold.

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: This means: covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: legs par bsdams pas /🔽lus bsrung ngo //
analyzed: legs par bsdams pas / lus bsrung ngo //
translated: By being well restrained,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: one should protect the body.

original: mi dge ba bcu las khyod kyis phung po gzem par bya'o zhes bya'o //🔽mnyam nyid @46a * //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu las khyod kyis phung po gzem par bya'o zhes bya'o // mnyam nyid @46a * //
translated: This means: you should protect the body by not committing the ten nonvirtues.

original: ye shes sems kyis su //
analyzed: ye shes sems kyis su //
translated: The mind of the wisdom of equality

original: ji ltar gsungs pa'i chos bstan pa //
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa'i chos bstan pa //
translated: teaches the Dharma as it is taught.

original: zhes pa ni slob ma bdag gzhan med pa'i sems bskyed na rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob ma bdag gzhan med pa'i sems bskyed na rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bstan par bya'o //
translated: If the disciple generates the mind of no self and other, one should teach the meaning of the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom.🔽After teaching the Dharma in that way, how should one give the precepts?

original: de ltar chos bstan pa'i 'og tu bslab pa ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar chos bstan pa'i 'og tu bslab pa ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: de nas gos kyis mig bkab cing //
analyzed: de nas gos kyis mig bkab cing //
translated: Then, with eyes covered by cloth,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: de la gtor mi'i sa ru zhes pa ni phyi nang gi sgo'i bar gyi sa'o //
analyzed: de la gtor mi'i sa ru zhes pa ni phyi nang gi sgo'i bar gyi sa'o //
translated: There, the “ground of the bali” is the ground between the inner and outer doors.

original: slob dpon la slob mas bslab pa ji ltar sbyin pa'i mdun du yang phyag 'tshal ba'i tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon la slob mas bslab pa ji ltar sbyin pa'i mdun du yang phyag 'tshal ba'i tshig gsungs pa /
translated: Manjusri-nama-samgiti:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dngos kyi sku//🔽zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dngos kyi sku// zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The body of all the Buddhas in reality,🔽The lion of speech, the great Bodhisattva,🔽The great hero Manjusri,🔽I pay homage to the good Manjusri.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis slob ma la smon lam btab pa'i don 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis slob ma la smon lam btab pa'i don 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: Then, the Master, for the sake of the disciple's desire for the fulfillment of the vow, says:

original: slob ma shes pa don dam smra ba'i seng ge yis //
analyzed: slob ma shes pa don dam smra ba'i seng ge yis //
translated: May the disciple, the lion of speech, the ultimate knower,

original: nyon mongs srid pa nyes pa bskyed pa'i sa gzhom dang // rnal 'byor cho gas nyon mongs g-yos pa gcod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nyon mongs srid pa nyes pa bskyed pa'i sa gzhom dang // rnal 'byor cho gas nyon mongs g-yos pa gcod pa'i phyir //
translated: Destroy the ground of the faults of the afflictions and of existence,🔽And may he accomplish the ultimate king of yoga, in order to cut off the🔽Agitation of the afflictions by the rite of yoga.🔽Having expressed the Dharma of the knowable by the words of the ultimate,

original: rnal 'byor don dam rgyal po de nyid 'grub 'gyur cig / ces de shes bya'i chos la don dam pa'i tshig gis brjod nas seng ge bzhin du rtog ba dang bral nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor don dam rgyal po de nyid 'grub 'gyur cig / ces de shes bya'i chos la don dam pa'i tshig gis brjod nas seng ge bzhin du rtog ba dang bral nas /
translated: Like a lion, free from conceptualization,

original: srid pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyon mongs pa gcod pa'i don du rnal 'byor cho ga dang / rnal 'byor gyi don dam pa rgyal po de nyid slob ma la grub par shog cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyon mongs pa gcod pa'i don du rnal 'byor cho ga dang / rnal 'byor gyi don dam pa rgyal po de nyid slob ma la grub par shog cig ces pa'o //
translated: For the sake of cutting off the afflictions that are the cause of existence, may the disciple be successful in the yoga rite and the ultimate yoga, the king of thatness.

original: de ltar smon lam btab pa'i 'og tu slob ma'i lus ngag yid la yi ge bkod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar smon lam btab pa'i 'og tu slob ma'i lus ngag yid la yi ge bkod pa gsungs pa /
translated: After making such aspirations, [the master] declares the arrangement of the syllables on the disciple's body, speech, and mind:

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces pa la sogs pa ste /🔽de la ye shes rdo rjer byin gyis brlab pa zhes pa ni slob ma'i lus ngag yid la /
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces pa la sogs pa ste / de la ye shes rdo rjer byin gyis brlab pa zhes pa ni slob ma'i lus ngag yid la /
translated: A is the supreme of all syllables.

original: aom a'a: h'um gis byin gyis brlabs ma thag tu nu ma'i bar du yang yi dam gyi lha'i sa bon gyis sems la bkod par bya ste /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um gis byin gyis brlabs ma thag tu nu ma'i bar du yang yi dam gyi lha'i sa bon gyis sems la bkod par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the consecration as the wisdom vajra is as follows: Having consecrated the disciple's body, speech, and mind with Om Ah Hum, immediately in between the breasts, one should place the seed syllable of the chosen deity in the mind.

original: phyag rgya bzhis gdab par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis gdab par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because [the disciple] is to be struck with the four seals.

original: bdud rtsi lnga dang ldan pa yi //🔽dam tshig chu yang sbyin par bya //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga dang ldan pa yi // dam tshig chu yang sbyin par bya //
translated: The pledge water endowed with the five elixirs

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: should also be given.

original: yi ge bkod zin ma thag tu bdud rtsi lnga dang / lcags kyu lnga dang ldan pa'i dam tshig bdud rtsi'i 'od kha la blud nas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge bkod zin ma thag tu bdud rtsi lnga dang / lcags kyu lnga dang ldan pa'i dam tshig bdud rtsi'i 'od kha la blud nas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: As soon as the syllables are written, one should give the pledge elixir, which is endowed with the five nectars and the five hooks, by placing it in the mouth.

original: bdud rtsi ci 'dra ba bzhin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: bdud rtsi ci 'dra ba bzhin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is the elixir like?

original: ha zhes pa yis kha dog 'phrog / ces pa la sogs pa ste don bshad zin to //
analyzed: ha zhes pa yis kha dog 'phrog / ces pa la sogs pa ste don bshad zin to //
translated: It is said, “The color is stolen by the syllable ha,” and so on. The meaning has been explained.

original: dam tshig phog zin ma thag tu gdong g-yogs bkrol nas slob ma @46b brkyang phyag bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: dam tshig phog zin ma thag tu gdong g-yogs bkrol nas slob ma @46b brkyang phyag bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: As soon as the pledge is given, the blindfold is removed, and the disciple should prostrate.

original: des ni mig grol mthong ma thag / thams cad yan lag lngas phyag bya //
analyzed: des ni mig grol mthong ma thag / thams cad yan lag lngas phyag bya //
translated: It is said, “As soon as the eyes are opened and one sees, one should prostrate with all five limbs.”

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la / sbyor ba'i gdan la dbul bar bya //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o // de la / sbyor ba'i gdan la dbul bar bya //
translated: And so on.

original: zhes pa ni me tog gi phreng ba lag par bzung nas dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gtor la phyag bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni me tog gi phreng ba lag par bzung nas dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gtor la phyag bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “One should offer it on the seat of union” means that one should offer prostrations while holding the flower garland in one’s hand and tossing it into the maṇḍala.

original: de kho na'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na'i don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of reality is stated:

original: de nas brtag par bya ba yang //
analyzed: de nas brtag par bya ba yang //
translated: “Then, one should also investigate

original: ji ltar rtags ni bstan par bya //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar rtags ni bstan par bya //🔽zhes pa ni /
translated: how the signs are shown.”

original: gong du dkyil 'khor gyi steng na gtor ma'i me tog gi phreng ba phyogs gar lhung ba slob dpon gyis mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gong du dkyil 'khor gyi steng na gtor ma'i me tog gi phreng ba phyogs gar lhung ba slob dpon gyis mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Above, it was said that the master should take note of the direction in which the flower garland of the sacrificial cake falls on the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor la me tog gang yang rung ba la lhung ba'i lha de ni slob ma la yi dam gyi lhar sbyin par bya'o zhes ston pas gsungs pa /🔽ji ltar lus dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la me tog gang yang rung ba la lhung ba'i lha de ni slob ma la yi dam gyi lhar sbyin par bya'o zhes ston pas gsungs pa / ji ltar lus dang ldan pa ni //
translated: The teacher is saying that he will show which deity, on the mandala, to which the disciple should be given as the pledged deity, depending on where the flower falls.🔽He says,🔽The wise one should give

original: mkhas pa yis ni sbyin par bya //
analyzed: mkhas pa yis ni sbyin par bya //
translated: to the one who is endowed with the body.

original: zhes pa'o // de la lus dang ldan pa ni zhes pa ni slob ma'i lus dang / me tog gi mtshan ma'i lha dang sbyor bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de la lus dang ldan pa ni zhes pa ni slob ma'i lus dang / me tog gi mtshan ma'i lha dang sbyor bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Here, “the one who is endowed with the body” means that the body of the disciple should be joined with the deity of the flower sign.

original: mkhas pa yis zhes pa ni slob dpon no /
analyzed: mkhas pa yis zhes pa ni slob dpon no /
translated: “The wise one” is the master.

original: de nas bslab sogs yang byas te //
analyzed: de nas bslab sogs yang byas te //
translated: Then, having again given the precepts, etc.,

original: zhes pa ni gong du bslab pa byin zin pa'i slob ma brtag pa'i 'og tu yang bslab pa dang / dam tshig kyang sbyin par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du bslab pa byin zin pa'i slob ma brtag pa'i 'og tu yang bslab pa dang / dam tshig kyang sbyin par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that after the disciple, to whom the precepts were given above, has been examined, the precepts and the pledges should also be given.

original: ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: ji ltar bstan pa yid kyis brtags //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa yid kyis brtags //
translated: One should mentally examine the teachings.

original: zhes pa ni bstan pa bslab pa'i tshig las mi 'byung ba gang dam tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bstan pa bslab pa'i tshig las mi 'byung ba gang dam tshig ste /
translated: The teachings are the commitments that do not appear in the words of the precepts.

original: 'gal ba thams cad slob dpon rang gis yid kyis brtags nas bya ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba thams cad slob dpon rang gis yid kyis brtags nas bya ste /
translated: All contradictions should be mentally examined by the master himself and done.

original: slob ma la smra bar bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slob ma la smra bar bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, “One should speak to the disciple.”

original: yang bslab pa sbyin pa'i sngon du mkha' 'gro ma dang / slob dpon la slob mas rang rang gi lus dbul ba'i tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang bslab pa sbyin pa'i sngon du mkha' 'gro ma dang / slob dpon la slob mas rang rang gi lus dbul ba'i tshig gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, prior to giving the precepts, the words of the disciple offering his body to the dakini and the master are stated:

original: bla ma'i zhabs kyi drung du ni //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhabs kyi drung du ni //
translated: At the feet of the guru🔽and so on, from the beginning

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dang po nas /🔽aom sa ka la satva pa ri tra n'a y'a /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dang po nas / aom sa ka la satva pa ri tra n'a y'a /
translated: up to:🔽Oṃ, I offer myself to the lord.

original: a'atma nam nirya t'a y'a mi /
analyzed: a'atma nam nirya t'a y'a mi /
translated: Please accept me,

original: zhes pa'i bar du'o //🔽gong du bslab sogs sbyin par bya //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du'o // gong du bslab sogs sbyin par bya //
translated: and so on.

original: zhes pa'i bslab pa'i tshig ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bslab pa'i tshig ni gang zhe na /
translated: As for the words of the precepts, which are stated in the line “The precepts and so on should be given,”

original: nga rgyal khro ba med bya zhing //
analyzed: nga rgyal khro ba med bya zhing //
translated: they are the words beginning with “One should be without pride and anger”

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dang po bzung nas /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dang po bzung nas /
translated: and so on, up to:

original: aa aa aom a'a:h'um dza:zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: aa aa aom a'a:h'um dza:zhes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: A A A OM A: HUM JAH

original: de la phyi'i gtsug lag ces pa ni /
analyzed: de la phyi'i gtsug lag ces pa ni /
translated: The outer scripture is

original: 'jig rten pa'i gtsug lag dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi gtsug lag dang / chos kyi gtsug lag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gtsug lag dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi gtsug lag dang / chos kyi gtsug lag go //
translated: the mundane scripture, the scripture of means and insight, and the scripture of Dharma.

original: de ltar bslab pa dang dam tshig @47a * //
analyzed: de ltar bslab pa dang dam tshig @47a * //
translated: Having thus given the training and the commitments,

original: byin nas dbang bskur ba'i 'og tu slob ma la sa bon bkod pa gsungs pa /🔽rdo rje phyag rgya sogs ldan pa //
analyzed: byin nas dbang bskur ba'i 'og tu slob ma la sa bon bkod pa gsungs pa / rdo rje phyag rgya sogs ldan pa //
translated: after the empowerment, it is said that the seed is placed on the disciple.

original: yan lag drug tu sa bon dgod //🔽ces pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag drug tu sa bon dgod // ces pa ste /
translated: The seed is placed on the six limbs

original: de la rdo rje phyag rgya ni //
analyzed: de la rdo rje phyag rgya ni //
translated: endowed with the vajra seal.🔽The vajra seal is

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje rtse lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje rtse lnga'o //
translated: the five-pointed vajra.

original: de ltar yang no pi ka las gsungs pa /🔽ye shes padma dang sbyar te //🔽sa yi gdugs dang rnam shes sbyor //
analyzed: de ltar yang no pi ka las gsungs pa / ye shes padma dang sbyar te // sa yi gdugs dang rnam shes sbyor //
translated: Thus it is said in the Nöpika:🔽The wisdom is joined with the lotus,

original: gnyi ga lu gu rgyud bcings te //
analyzed: gnyi ga lu gu rgyud bcings te //
translated: the earth with the parasol, and the consciousness.🔽Both are bound with a chain,

original: lhag ma rnams ni gyen du bsgreng //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gyen du bsgreng //
translated: the rest are raised upward.

original: dud pa dri ma gsum spangs te //
analyzed: dud pa dri ma gsum spangs te //
translated: The smoke and the three stains are abandoned,

original: rtse lnga rdo rje 'dzin la sogs //
analyzed: rtse lnga rdo rje 'dzin la sogs //
translated: the five-pointed vajra, and so forth.

original: zhes so // yan lag drug tu sa bon dgod //
analyzed: zhes so // yan lag drug tu sa bon dgod //
translated: The seed is placed on the six limbs.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de la yan lag drug ces pa ni /
analyzed: de la yan lag drug ces pa ni /
translated: As for the six limbs,

original: spyi bo dang / mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / snying ga dang / sa bon zhes pa ni kshum dang / h'um dang / yum dang / sum dang / h'um ngo /
analyzed: spyi bo dang / mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / snying ga dang / sa bon zhes pa ni kshum dang / h'um dang / yum dang / sum dang / h'um ngo /
translated: the head, eyes, ears, nose, tongue, heart, and seed are the kṣa, hūṃ, yūṃ, suṃ, and hūṃ.

original: don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: rdo rje slob dpon gyis rtse lnga ba'i phyag rgya bcas nas slob ma'i spyi bo la sogs pa la reg nas yi ge kshum la sogs pa brjod nas bkod par bya'o zhes pa'o//
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gyis rtse lnga ba'i phyag rgya bcas nas slob ma'i spyi bo la sogs pa la reg nas yi ge kshum la sogs pa brjod nas bkod par bya'o zhes pa'o//
translated: The vajra master, having formed the five-pronged mudra, touches the disciple’s head, and so on, and should arrange the kṣa, and so on.

original: yi ge lnga drug tu byas pa ni rna ba dang sna la yi ge yum kho na bkod pas drug go //
analyzed: yi ge lnga drug tu byas pa ni rna ba dang sna la yi ge yum kho na bkod pas drug go //
translated: The five syllables are made into six by arranging the syllable yūṃ on the ears and nose, making six.

original: gzhan yang chos rnams thams cad la /🔽byang chub rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos rnams thams cad la / byang chub rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan //
translated: Moreover, in all phenomena

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: the stage of perfect awakening is taught.

original: dbang bskur ba dang / yig 'bru bkod pa las gzhan lung dang man ngag gi chos dang gzhan yang lha'i de kho na nyid dang / dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu ston par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang / yig 'bru bkod pa las gzhan lung dang man ngag gi chos dang gzhan yang lha'i de kho na nyid dang / dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu ston par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should teach the cause of perfect enlightenment, which is other than the Dharma of transmission and esoteric instruction, and also other than the reality of the deity, the reality of the mandala, and so forth.

original: dbang bskur zin ma thag tu yon dbul ba'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: dbang bskur zin ma thag tu yon dbul ba'i don gsungs pa /
translated: Immediately after the initiation, one should offer a gift.

original: de nas rtag tu slob dpon la //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas rtag tu slob dpon la // zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, always to the master,

original: bla ma'i yon du dbul bar bya //
analyzed: bla ma'i yon du dbul bar bya //
translated: one should offer a gift,

original: zhes pa'i bar du'o //🔽gong gi // byang chub rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du'o // gong gi // byang chub rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan //
translated: as much as one can,🔽in order to repay his kindness.🔽 The line above, the stage of perfect enlightenment is taught,

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis byang chub rdzogs pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de ye shes kyi tshogs kyi sgo nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis byang chub rdzogs pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de ye shes kyi tshogs kyi sgo nas gsungs pa /
translated: teaches the stage of perfect enlightenment by way of the accumulation of wisdom.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin dag pa rang bzhin de ni ngo bo med //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin dag pa rang bzhin de ni ngo bo med //
translated: The nature of phenomena is pure, that nature is essenceless.

original: dngos po rang bzhin yang med de /🔽byang chub rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin yang med de / byang chub rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan //
translated: Things have no nature,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: the stage of perfect enlightenment is taught.

original: de la / rang bzhin de ni ngo bo med //
analyzed: de la / rang bzhin de ni ngo bo med //
translated: It has no nature, no essence.

original: ces pa ni chos nyid rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: ces pa ni chos nyid rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Since the nature of reality is emptiness,

original: dngos su mi 'gyur te bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su mi 'gyur te bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it does not actually exist, because it transcends thought.

original: ngo bo rang bzhin yang med de //
analyzed: ngo bo rang bzhin yang med de //
translated: It has no essence, no nature.

original: zhes pa ni dmigs pa'i chos rnams ngo bo yang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin te zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dmigs pa'i chos rnams ngo bo yang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin te zhes pa ste /
translated: The objective phenomena are also empty by nature.

original: rten cing 'brel pa las @47b 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa las @47b 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they arise in dependence and relation.

original: des na ngo bo dang rang bzhin ni dbyer med par bstan te /
analyzed: des na ngo bo dang rang bzhin ni dbyer med par bstan te /
translated: Therefore, essence and nature are taught to be inseparable.

original: rten cing 'brel pa'i chos dang stong pa nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa'i chos dang stong pa nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the phenomena of dependence and relation and emptiness are not different.

original: de ltar na klu sgrub zhabs kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstod pa las gsungs pa /🔽ngo bo las gzhan stong pa min //
analyzed: de ltar na klu sgrub zhabs kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstod pa las gsungs pa / ngo bo las gzhan stong pa min //
translated: Thus, it is as stated in the Praise of the Perfection of Wisdom by the venerable Nāgārjuna:🔽It is not empty of the entity that is other.

original: stong pa la yang ngo po med //
analyzed: stong pa la yang ngo po med //
translated: Nor is emptiness an entity.

original: des na rten cing 'brel stong nyid //
analyzed: des na rten cing 'brel stong nyid //
translated: Therefore, dependent origination is emptiness.

original: lha khyod kyis ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lha khyod kyis ni bstan pa'o //
translated: This, O god, you have taught.

original: zhes pa'o // yang dang yang du gzhan yang byang chub rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi sgo nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // yang dang yang du gzhan yang byang chub rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi sgo nas gsungs pa /
translated: And again and again, moreover, the stage of perfecting enlightenment is taught from the perspective of the accumulation of merit.

original: sngon du bzod pa'i tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: sngon du bzod pa'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: First, through the method of forbearance,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: de la kun mkhyen slob ma zhes pa ni phyi nang gi don bstan zin par slob ma ni kun mkhyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la kun mkhyen slob ma zhes pa ni phyi nang gi don bstan zin par slob ma ni kun mkhyen zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the disciple of the Omniscient One is called the Omniscient One, having been taught the inner and outer meanings.

original: mnyam nyid ye shes bskyed nas ni //
analyzed: mnyam nyid ye shes bskyed nas ni //
translated: Having generated the gnosis of equality,

original: thams cad mnyam par blta bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mnyam par blta bya'o //
translated: one should view everything as equal.

original: zhes pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i sems bskyed nas /
translated: This means that having generated the mind of existence and nonexistence,

original: sems can kun mnyam par blta'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can kun mnyam par blta'o zhes pa'o //
translated: one should view all sentient beings as equal.

original: rtag tu mnyam par spyod pa yi //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par spyod pa yi //
translated: Always practicing equally,

original: sbyor ba'i bsam gtan mchog tu brtson //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bsam gtan mchog tu brtson //
translated: one should strive for the supreme concentration of union.

original: zhes pa ni yod med dmigs par sbyor ba'i nyid nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yod med dmigs par sbyor ba'i nyid nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one should cultivate the samadhi of union with the reference of existence and nonexistence.

original: de kho na'i dpe bstan pa /
analyzed: de kho na'i dpe bstan pa /
translated: The example of thatness is taught:

original: sems can sbyin la sred pa'i gzhi //
analyzed: sems can sbyin la sred pa'i gzhi //
translated: The basis of sentient beings' craving for generosity,

original: tshod bzhin 'bras bu 'phel ba yis //
analyzed: tshod bzhin 'bras bu 'phel ba yis //
translated: The fruit increases like interest on a loan.

original: de yi myu gu ljon shing gis //
analyzed: de yi myu gu ljon shing gis //
translated: The tree of its sprout

original: 'gro ba'i lam ni 'gag par 'gyur //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i lam ni 'gag par 'gyur // zhes pa ste /
translated: blocks the path of the world.

original: rnal 'byor pas sbyin pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byas na tshong bzhin du 'phel nas tshe phyi ma la 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas sbyin pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byas na tshong bzhin du 'phel nas tshe phyi ma la 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: If the yogi practices generosity and so forth by way of apprehending, it increases like a loan and becomes the fruit in the next life.

original: 'bras bu de srid pa'i dngos po yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gro ba'i lam ljon shing bzhin du 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu de srid pa'i dngos po yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gro ba'i lam ljon shing bzhin du 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Since that fruit is a thing of cyclic existence, it blocks the path of the world to nirvana like a tree. This is the meaning.

original: 'bras bu'i de kho na gang zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i de kho na gang zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is the reality of the fruit? It is stated:

original: mtho ris longs spyod 'dod phyir du //
analyzed: mtho ris longs spyod 'dod phyir du //
translated: For the sake of the enjoyments of high status

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyi bsod nams kyis ni mtho ris lha dang mir skyes nas longs spyod pa de ni srid pa la ltung ba yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyi bsod nams kyis ni mtho ris lha dang mir skyes nas longs spyod pa de ni srid pa la ltung ba yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Merit by way of apprehending produces birth as a god or human in high status and the enjoyments there. That is a fall into cyclic existence. This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir na rnal 'byor bas gnyis su med pa'i don bsgoms pa spangs pa mchod rten bskor ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'i las kun mi bya'o zhes ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir na rnal 'byor bas gnyis su med pa'i don bsgoms pa spangs pa mchod rten bskor ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'i las kun mi bya'o zhes ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the yogi/nī should not perform any ritual action with reference to the object, such as circumambulating a stūpa, etc., which is abandoned by the cultivation of the meaning of nonduality.🔽The text is spoken with the desire to teach this.

original: mchod rten las ni mi bya zhing //
analyzed: mchod rten las ni mi bya zhing //
translated: Do not perform stūpa rituals.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so forth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gtsug lag rnams ni rnyed sla ste //
analyzed: gtsug lag rnams ni rnyed sla ste //
translated: The scriptures are easy to obtain,

original: 'di yi lung ni thos pa dka' //
analyzed: 'di yi lung ni thos pa dka' //
translated: but it is difficult to hear the transmission of this.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /🔽phyi'i gtsug @48a * //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste / phyi'i gtsug @48a * //
translated: And so forth.

original: lag rnams thos pa dang / shes par bya ba ni sla'o //
analyzed: lag rnams thos pa dang / shes par bya ba ni sla'o //
translated: The external scriptures are easy to hear and understand.

original: gnyis su med pa'i don man ngag tu gyur pa ni slob dpon gyi zhal nas ma yin pa gzhan nas rnyed par dka' bas de kho na bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i don man ngag tu gyur pa ni slob dpon gyi zhal nas ma yin pa gzhan nas rnyed par dka' bas de kho na bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of nonduality, which is the esoteric instruction, is difficult to obtain from anyone other than the teacher’s mouth. Therefore, the text is saying that only that should be cultivated.🔽One’s own deity and another deity,

original: bdag nyid lha'i dang gzhan lha dang // bdag nyid lha ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid lha'i dang gzhan lha dang // bdag nyid lha ni mchog yin no //
translated: one’s own deity is supreme.

original: zhes pa ni gzhan sku gzugs la sogs pa'i lha dang / rang gi snying gar bsgoms pa'i ye shes sems dpa'i lha gtsor gyur pas na bsgom pa kho na bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzhan sku gzugs la sogs pa'i lha dang / rang gi snying gar bsgoms pa'i ye shes sems dpa'i lha gtsor gyur pas na bsgom pa kho na bsngags pa'o //
translated: This praises only the meditation, since the deity is primarily the image of the Buddha, etc., and the deity of the wisdom being who is meditated in one's heart.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the Lord himself has said:

original: lus la tshad ma sems yin no //
analyzed: lus la tshad ma sems yin no //
translated: The mind is the measure of the body.🔽Well, how is it with the external image, the stupa, etc.?

original: zhes pa'o // 'o na phyi'i gzugs brnyan dang / mchod rten la sogs pa ji ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'o na phyi'i gzugs brnyan dang / mchod rten la sogs pa ji ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: bdag nyid gzugs su mi shes pas //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzugs su mi shes pas //
translated: Since one does not know the form of the self,

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs brtag par bya //🔽zhes pa'o // pandi ta smri ti dzny'a na k'irtis mdzad pa'i dpal ldan gdan bzhi pa gzigs pa las /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs brtag par bya // zhes pa'o // pandi ta smri ti dzny'a na k'irtis mdzad pa'i dpal ldan gdan bzhi pa gzigs pa las /
translated: one should contemplate the image, etc.

original: gsang ba'i gdan gyi le'u dang po'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gsang ba'i gdan gyi le'u dang po'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the first chapter of the glorious Catuhpitha Tantra, composed by the pandit Smriti Jnana Kirti.

original: // / da ni slob dpon lung nas ston 'dod pa'i bar bya'o zhes pa tshig gi don ston 'dod pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyis /
analyzed: // / da ni slob dpon lung nas ston 'dod pa'i bar bya'o zhes pa tshig gi don ston 'dod pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyis /
translated: Now, the teacher wishes to teach the section up to the prediction.

original: de la 'byor pa rnyed dka' ba //
analyzed: de la 'byor pa rnyed dka' ba //
translated: The difficulty of obtaining the endowment is stated in the verse beginning with the words, Therein, the endowment is difficult to obtain.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas gsang ba'i gdan le'u gnyis pa la sems kyis bsgrub pa brtsams so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas gsang ba'i gdan le'u gnyis pa la sems kyis bsgrub pa brtsams so //
translated: Thus, in the second chapter, the Secret Seat, he begins the practice of the mind with the words, The yogi who is devoted to the practice of the mantra should first of all generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: de la / rang don spyod pa'i sngags pa rnams //🔽de bzhin nyid med sred par 'khor //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la / rang don spyod pa'i sngags pa rnams // de bzhin nyid med sred par 'khor // zhes pa ni /
translated: Therein, the verse beginning with the words, The mantra practitioners who engage in the practice for their own benefit,

original: rang gi don du dmigs nas sbyin pa la sogs pa gtong ba'i rnal 'byor ba dang / gnyis su med pa'i don ston pa nyid de kho na nyid mi shes pa ni mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan na yang srid pas 'khor ro zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi don du dmigs nas sbyin pa la sogs pa gtong ba'i rnal 'byor ba dang / gnyis su med pa'i don ston pa nyid de kho na nyid mi shes pa ni mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan na yang srid pas 'khor ro zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that those who, not knowing reality, engage in the practice of giving and so forth with the aim of their own benefit, even if they possess realization, are said to wander in existence.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i don la the tshom zos pa phyag na rdo rjes zhus pa /🔽ya mtshan can gyi lus dag pa //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i don la the tshom zos pa phyag na rdo rjes zhus pa / ya mtshan can gyi lus dag pa //
translated: Then, Vajrapani, having doubts about the meaning of Tathagata, asked, The body of the wonderous one is pure.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, he said, The body of the wonderous one is pure, and so forth.

original: de la / ya mtshan can gyi lus dag pa //
analyzed: de la / ya mtshan can gyi lus dag pa //
translated: Therein, the verse beginning with the words, The body of the wonderous one is pure,🔽means that the body of the wonderous one is pure.

original: zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la phung por snang ba ni ya mtshan no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la phung por snang ba ni ya mtshan no //
translated: This is to say, it is amazing that the appearance of the aggregates should occur in the nature of nondual emptiness.

original: de kho na bshad pa /
analyzed: de kho na bshad pa /
translated: The reality is explained:

original: chos nyid 'di dag bstan pa yin //
analyzed: chos nyid 'di dag bstan pa yin //
translated: These dharmas are taught.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: This is saying,

original: chos nyid gnyis su med pa stong pa nyid las 'di dag phung po dang khams dang skye mched bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid gnyis su med pa stong pa nyid las 'di dag phung po dang khams dang skye mched bstan pa'o //
translated: from the nondual reality of emptiness, these dharmas of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are taught.

original: de 'dra ba'i lus de kho na la tshad mar gyur pa gang yin zhes yang zhus pa /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i lus de kho na la tshad mar gyur pa gang yin zhes yang zhus pa /
translated: The question is asked, What is the valid cognition in regard to that very body?

original: gang gis tshad mar @48b sbyor ba dang // zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis tshad mar @48b sbyor ba dang // zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is given beginning with The one who applies valid cognition.

original: de la don bsdus pa'i sgo nas lan gsungs pa //
analyzed: de la don bsdus pa'i sgo nas lan gsungs pa //
translated: The answer is given in terms of a summary:

original: nyon cig ji ltar rdo rje mtshan //
analyzed: nyon cig ji ltar rdo rje mtshan //
translated: Listen! Just as the vajra mark...

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is saying,

original: de la lus la tshad ma sems yin te zhes pa khams gsum gyi sems can gyi phung po lnga'i tshad ma ni sems yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la lus la tshad ma sems yin te zhes pa khams gsum gyi sems can gyi phung po lnga'i tshad ma ni sems yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mind is the valid cognition in regard to the body means that the valid cognition of the five aggregates of sentient beings in the three realms is the mind.

original: gang gis tshad ma rnams shes pa la sogs pa ni zhus pa'i lan gsungs pa /🔽bdag gi khams la bdud rtsi yis //🔽gtor ma'i las rnams gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: gang gis tshad ma rnams shes pa la sogs pa ni zhus pa'i lan gsungs pa / bdag gi khams la bdud rtsi yis // gtor ma'i las rnams gsungs pa yin //
translated: The reply to the question, “By what are the valid cognitions of the body, speech, and mind known?”

original: zhes pa ste /🔽'og nas 'byung ba'i bdud rtsi'i cho gas bdag gi lus kyi lha rnams tshim par bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ste / 'og nas 'byung ba'i bdud rtsi'i cho gas bdag gi lus kyi lha rnams tshim par bya ba ni /
translated: is stated:🔽“The oblation rite is stated🔽with the nectar of one’s own elements.”

original: gtor ma'i tshad ma zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtor ma'i tshad ma zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The satisfaction of the deities of one’s own body by the rite of nectar that will be stated below is the meaning of “the valid cognition of the oblation.”

original: chu dang me zhes pa la sogs pa zhus pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: chu dang me zhes pa la sogs pa zhus pa'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to the question, “What are the valid cognitions of water, fire, and so on?”🔽is stated:

original: dkyil 'khor me dang chu dag dang // zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor me dang chu dag dang // zhes pa ste /
translated: “The maṇḍala, fire, and water.”

original: chu la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi lus la tshad mar gyur pa ni dkyil 'khor yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi lus la tshad mar gyur pa ni dkyil 'khor yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The four great elements, water and so on, that are valid cognitions for the body are the maṇḍala.

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i tshad ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i tshad ma zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the valid cognition of mantra and mudra.🔽The reply to the question, “What is the valid cognition of going and so on?”

original: 'di la 'gro ba zhes pa la sogs pa zhus pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di la 'gro ba zhes pa la sogs pa zhus pa'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: is stated:

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: “The yogi/nī who has attained the result

original: srid pa'i rgya mtshor ltung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgya mtshor ltung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes pa ste /
translated: will fall into the ocean of existence.”

original: gang zhig la brten nas bsgom par byas na /
analyzed: gang zhig la brten nas bsgom par byas na /
translated: If one meditates in dependence on that,

original: rnal 'byor ba'i srid pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i srid pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: it becomes the fruit of the yogi’s existence,

original: des mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam 'gags nas srid pa la 'khor te /
analyzed: des mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam 'gags nas srid pa la 'khor te /
translated: because that blocks the path to nirvana and one circles in existence,

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of meditating in a way that has a reference.

original: de ltar yang klu sgrub zhabs kyis rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang klu sgrub zhabs kyis rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the venerable Nagarjuna also says in the Yogacaryā-mūlamadhyamaka:

original: gang dag stong nyid mi shes pa //
analyzed: gang dag stong nyid mi shes pa //
translated: Those who do not understand emptiness

original: de dag thar pa'i skal mi ldan //
analyzed: de dag thar pa'i skal mi ldan //
translated: are not fortunate for liberation.

original: srid pa'i 'khor ba 'gro drug la //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor ba 'gro drug la //
translated: In the cycle of existence, the six kinds of transmigrators,

original: gti mug can de yang dag 'khor //
analyzed: gti mug can de yang dag 'khor //
translated: those ignorant ones truly circle.

original: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas lus la sems tshad ma bstan pa'i don la the tshom zos nas phyag na rdo rjes yang zhus pa /
analyzed: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas lus la sems tshad ma bstan pa'i don la the tshom zos nas phyag na rdo rjes yang zhus pa /
translated: Having doubted the meaning of the Bhagavat Vajrasattva’s teaching of the measure of mind in the body, Vajrapāṇi again asked:

original: phyag na rdo rjes yang gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes yang gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Vajrapāṇi again said…

original: zhus pa'i lan rgyas pa'i sgo nas ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhus pa'i lan rgyas pa'i sgo nas ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: Desiring to teach by way of an extensive reply, he said:

original: nyon cig 'khor ba'i zhus pa de //
analyzed: nyon cig 'khor ba'i zhus pa de //
translated: Listen, O retinue, to your question!

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽de la sems kyi mtshan nyid gdul bar bya'o zhes pa ni 'khor ba'i nang nas lus la tshad mar gyur pa'i sems de kho na gdul bya mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / de la sems kyi mtshan nyid gdul bar bya'o zhes pa ni 'khor ba'i nang nas lus la tshad mar gyur pa'i sems de kho na gdul bya mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: and so on.🔽Therein, the characteristic of mind is to be disciplined.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: From within cyclic existence, just that mind which is the measure of the body is to be disciplined, not another.

original: sems de kho na khams gsum @49a * //
analyzed: sems de kho na khams gsum @49a * //
translated: That very mind is the three realms,🔽appearing as a special object.

original: du khyad par du snang ba'i ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: du khyad par du snang ba'i ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: The desire to teach is stated:

original: ma dgar ye shes gzugs med pa //
analyzed: ma dgar ye shes gzugs med pa //
translated: The formless is not the form of pristine consciousness,

original: mkha' 'gro rlung gis bskyod pa bzhin //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro rlung gis bskyod pa bzhin // zhes pa ni /
translated: like a ḍākinī moved by the wind.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su sems phung po bzhir gyur pa ni nam mkha' la rlung bzhin rang dgar snang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su sems phung po bzhir gyur pa ni nam mkha' la rlung bzhin rang dgar snang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: The four heaps of mind in the formless realm appear as one wishes, like the wind in space.

original: gzugs dang gzugs ni sems kyis kyang //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs ni sems kyis kyang //
translated: Form and form are also accomplished by the mind,

original: ting 'dzin dmigs pas 'grub par 'gyur //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ting 'dzin dmigs pas 'grub par 'gyur // zhes pa ni /
translated: by the visualization of samādhi.

original: de la gzugs dang zhes pa ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: de la gzugs dang zhes pa ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: Therein, “form” is the form realm.

original: gzugs ni sems kyis kyang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs ni sems kyis kyang zhes pa ni /
translated: “Form is also by the mind”🔽means

original: sems de tshangs ris la sogs pa gzugs khams bcu bdun du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems de tshangs ris la sogs pa gzugs khams bcu bdun du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: That mind becomes the seventeen levels of the form realm, such as the Brahmakayika.

original: ting 'dzin dmigs pas 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: ting 'dzin dmigs pas 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: It is accomplished by the focus of samadhi.

original: zhes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi rtog dpyod dga' bde bzhir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi rtog dpyod dga' bde bzhir dmigs pa'o //
translated: The four dhyanas are focused on the four aspects of investigation, analysis, joy, and bliss.

original: don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: gzugs khams de ni bsam gtan bzhi la phung po lngar gyur nas gzugs bcu bdun du snang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs khams de ni bsam gtan bzhi la phung po lngar gyur nas gzugs bcu bdun du snang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: The form realm appears as the seventeen levels of the form realm, having become the five skandhas of the four dhyanas.

original: 'dod pa'i lha sogs 'dod can rnams//🔽rtag tu 'dod pa spyod pa yin //🔽zhes pa ni /🔽'dod khams na sems de 'dod pa'i lha rgyal chen ris bzhi la sogs pa 'dod pa'i lha ris drug phung po lngar gyur nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha sogs 'dod can rnams// rtag tu 'dod pa spyod pa yin // zhes pa ni / 'dod khams na sems de 'dod pa'i lha rgyal chen ris bzhi la sogs pa 'dod pa'i lha ris drug phung po lngar gyur nas /
translated: The desire realm is the desire of the gods and so on.🔽The desire realm is the six classes of desire gods, such as the Caturmaharajakas.

original: rtag tu 'dod chags kyis longs spyod pa snang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu 'dod chags kyis longs spyod pa snang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: Having become the five skandhas, they appear to always enjoy desire with attachment.

original: de ltar 'khor ba'i mi rnams ni //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba'i mi rnams ni //
translated: Thus, the humans of samsara

original: rang dgar sa dag 'grub par 'gyur//
analyzed: rang dgar sa dag 'grub par 'gyur//
translated: always accomplish the levels of their own desire.

original: 'dod pa'i khams de kho na la yang sems de ni dmyal ba brgyad dang yi dags dang / byol song dang / gling bzhi rnams la phung po lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams de kho na la yang sems de ni dmyal ba brgyad dang yi dags dang / byol song dang / gling bzhi rnams la phung po lngar 'gyur te /
translated: In the desire realm itself, that mind is the five aggregates in the eight hells, hungry ghosts, animals, and the four continents.

original: 'khor zhing snang ngo //
analyzed: 'khor zhing snang ngo //
translated: It appears as the cycle.

original: de la yang mir 'gyur ba la sems btul nas 'dod pa'i sa mya ngan las 'das pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang mir 'gyur ba la sems btul nas 'dod pa'i sa mya ngan las 'das pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: And in the case of humans, having disciplined the mind, one should attain nirvana in the desire realm.

original: de bas na khams gsum la sems gtso ba'i phyir na lung la sems tshad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na khams gsum la sems gtso ba'i phyir na lung la sems tshad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, since the mind is primary in the three realms, it is said that the scriptures are measured by the mind.

original: de dang mdo las kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dang mdo las kyang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is also said in the sutra:

original: kye rgyal ba'i bu khams gsum ni sems tsam mo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i bu khams gsum ni sems tsam mo zhes pa'o //
translated: O son of the victors, the three realms are merely mind.

original: da ni sems 'dul ba'i thabs mdor bsdus nas bstan 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni sems 'dul ba'i thabs mdor bsdus nas bstan 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: Now, wishing to teach in brief the means of disciplining the mind, it is said:

original: de las sgrol ba'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: de las sgrol ba'i dngos po ni //
translated: The means of liberation from that...🔽and so on.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Among them,

original: de la / de las sgrol ba'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: de la / de las sgrol ba'i dngos po ni //
translated: The means of liberation from that

original: zhes pa ni de dag khams gsum las grol nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu nyon cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de dag khams gsum las grol nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu nyon cig ces pa'o //
translated: means having liberated from those three realms, listen to the cause of nirvana.

original: rgyu gang zhe na gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang zhe na gsungs pa'o //
translated: What is the cause?

original: 'gro ba 'grub byed rnal 'byor pas //🔽rnam shes lhan cig shes par bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'grub byed rnal 'byor pas // rnam shes lhan cig shes par bya //
translated: The yogi who accomplishes the world

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: should know consciousness together with wisdom.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam @49b sgrub par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas thabs dang shes rab dang / rang bzhin lhan cig gcig pa'i ye shes dang rnam par shes pa kho na'i mtshan nyid kyi phyag na rdo rjes shes par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam @49b sgrub par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas thabs dang shes rab dang / rang bzhin lhan cig gcig pa'i ye shes dang rnam par shes pa kho na'i mtshan nyid kyi phyag na rdo rjes shes par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The yogi who accomplishes the path of nirvana should know Vajrapani, who has the nature of method and wisdom, and the wisdom that is of one nature with the innate, and who is only the characteristic of consciousness.

original: don de kho na yang dang yang du zhus pa /
analyzed: don de kho na yang dang yang du zhus pa /
translated: The meaning of that is asked again and again:

original: sems kyi ngo bo the tshom na //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo the tshom na //
translated: If the nature of mind is doubted,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: de kho na'i lan ston pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na'i lan ston pas gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to that is taught:

original: shel dang mtshungs par sems pa ni //
analyzed: shel dang mtshungs par sems pa ni //
translated: The mind is like a crystal,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /🔽de la / shel dang mtshungs par sems pa ni //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste / de la / shel dang mtshungs par sems pa ni //
translated: and so on.

original: zhes pa ni sems ni nyon mongs pa glo bur yin pas shel bzhin du dag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems ni nyon mongs pa glo bur yin pas shel bzhin du dag pa ste /
translated: There, “the mind is like a crystal” means that the mind is pure like a crystal because the afflictions are adventitious.

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature is luminous.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: skyon dang yon tan sems la med //🔽ces pa ste /
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan sems la med // ces pa ste /
translated: Faults and good qualities do not exist in the mind.

original: de la skyon ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la skyon ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Here, faults are the afflictions.

original: yon tan ni de'i gnyen po lam gnyis kyi shes rab bo //🔽de gnyis don dam par med do zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yon tan ni de'i gnyen po lam gnyis kyi shes rab bo // de gnyis don dam par med do zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Good qualities are the wisdom of the two paths that are the antidotes to those.

original: de 'dra ba'i sems gzung 'dzin gyi sgo nas gzhan dbang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sems gzung 'dzin gyi sgo nas gzhan dbang du 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the statement “those two do not exist ultimately” is that the mind is under the power of the other-dependent through the mode of apprehender and apprehended.

original: srid pa'i nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro zhes ston pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: srid pa'i nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro zhes ston pas gsungs pa /
translated: The statement by the teacher that the mind is “covered by the faults of cyclic existence, which are afflicted” is presented in the following:

original: sbyor ba yul du 'jug pa yis //
analyzed: sbyor ba yul du 'jug pa yis //
translated: Through the engagement in objects,

original: 'khor ba'i skyon gyis gos pa yin //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i skyon gyis gos pa yin // zhes pa ni /
translated: it is covered by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: de la sbyor ba zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa dbang po drug go //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa dbang po drug go //
translated: Here, “engagement” refers to the six sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: yul du zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i spyod yul drug go //
analyzed: yul du zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i spyod yul drug go //
translated: “Objects” refers to the six objects such as form.

original: 'jug pa yis zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: 'jug pa yis zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug go //
translated: “Engagement” refers to the six consciousnesses of engagement.

original: gzung 'dzin de dag gi dbang gis sems de srid pa'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyis gos pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin de dag gi dbang gis sems de srid pa'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyis gos pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Through the power of those apprehender and apprehended, the mind is “covered by the faults of cyclic existence, which are afflicted.”

original: srid pa'i rgyur gyur pa spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur gyur pa la brten par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyur gyur pa spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur gyur pa la brten par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Since one has abandoned the cause of existence, one should rely on the cause of nirvana.

original: yul la gnas pa sngangs nas su //🔽ji ltar gnas su sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: yul la gnas pa sngangs nas su // ji ltar gnas su sbyar bar bya //
translated: Having been frightened by the object,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: how should one be applied to the abode?

original: srid pa'i dngos po phyin ci log pa'i spyod yul spangs nas yang dag pa'i gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dngos po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lha mo ru bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i dngos po phyin ci log pa'i spyod yul spangs nas yang dag pa'i gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dngos po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lha mo ru bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned the object of existence, the sphere of error, one should meditate on the object of nirvana, the abode of reality, the goddess, by way of non-apprehension.

original: de ltar yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'am byang ba'i ka ri ka las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'am byang ba'i ka ri ka las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Kṣaṇabhangadhyāya:

original: gzhan dbang 'di yi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: gzhan dbang 'di yi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of this dependent

original: mtshan nyid cha ni gnyis pa ste //🔽brtags pa'i cha yis 'khor ba ste //
analyzed: mtshan nyid cha ni gnyis pa ste // brtags pa'i cha yis 'khor ba ste //
translated: is twofold, characterized as🔽the imagined part, samsara,

original: grub pa'i cha yis mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: grub pa'i cha yis mya ngan 'das //
translated: and the accomplished part, nirvana.

original: zhes pa'o // de'i dper gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de'i dper gsungs pa /
translated: The example of that is stated:

original: bu dang slob ma bslab pa bzhin //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bu dang slob ma bslab pa bzhin //🔽zhes pa ste /
translated: Like a son, a student, and a trainee.

original: skyon dang yon tan phyogs med pa la bu dang slob ma byis pa'i dus na yon tan kho na @50a * //
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan phyogs med pa la bu dang slob ma byis pa'i dus na yon tan kho na @50a * //
translated: In the case of faults and virtues, one should not be partial. When children are young, one should only teach them virtues.

original: la lobs par byas nas yang dag pa'i rig pa dang ldan par byas pa bzhin du rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i sems kyang yang dag pa'i don rtogs par byas nas mya ngan las 'das par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: la lobs par byas nas yang dag pa'i rig pa dang ldan par byas pa bzhin du rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i sems kyang yang dag pa'i don rtogs par byas nas mya ngan las 'das par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Having made them learn, one should endow them with right knowledge. In the same way, one should make the mind, which is by nature clear light, realize the right meaning and attain nirvana.

original: de'i dbus su zhes bya ba //
analyzed: de'i dbus su zhes bya ba //
translated: In the middle of that

original: rnam par shes pa mkha' bzhin brtag /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mkha' bzhin brtag /
translated: consciousness should be imagined to be like space.

original: ces pa ni sems de ni yod med kyi dbus su brtags nas rnam par shes pa yang rtag tu nam mkha' bzhin du tha snyad du yod la dpyod du med par snang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni sems de ni yod med kyi dbus su brtags nas rnam par shes pa yang rtag tu nam mkha' bzhin du tha snyad du yod la dpyod du med par snang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: Having imagined that mind in the middle of existence and nonexistence, one should imagine that consciousness always appears like space, conventionally existent but not to be analyzed.

original: mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is its defining characteristic? It is said:

original: kha dog med cing mtshon kun dngos //
analyzed: kha dog med cing mtshon kun dngos //
translated: It is without color, the universal substance.

original: zhes pa ste de la kha dog med cing zhes pa ni ;
analyzed: zhes pa ste de la kha dog med cing zhes pa ni ;
translated: Therein, “without color” means

original: sems de dbang po las 'das pas nag po dang / ser po la sogs pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: sems de dbang po las 'das pas nag po dang / ser po la sogs pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Since the mind is beyond the senses, it is not a thing such as black or yellow,

original: dngos po thams cad rten cing 'brel pa tsam gyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rten cing 'brel pa tsam gyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things arise merely in dependence and relation.

original: mtshon kun dngos zhes pa ni mtshon thams cad kyi ngo bo yang sems las 'byung ba yin pas mtshon kun dngos yin te /
analyzed: mtshon kun dngos zhes pa ni mtshon thams cad kyi ngo bo yang sems las 'byung ba yin pas mtshon kun dngos yin te /
translated: All weapons are things, because the nature of all weapons arises from the mind.

original: phyi'i rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not exist as external substances.

original: 'brel pa med cing zhes pa ni sems de thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med cing zhes pa ni sems de thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not related, because the mind is unimpeded.

original: 'brel ba'i gzugs zhes pa ni sems de yang yan lag dang nyid lag tshang ba'i gzugs sam bum pa dang snam bu la sogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel ba'i gzugs zhes pa ni sems de yang yan lag dang nyid lag tshang ba'i gzugs sam bum pa dang snam bu la sogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Related form is the mind that has become a form with complete major and minor parts, such as a pot, a cloth, and so on.

original: gzugs med ces pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med ces pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is formless, because it is the nature of mind and mental factors.

original: thams cad gzugs can dang zhes pa ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad gzugs can dang zhes pa ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is all forms, because it is the nature of forms, sounds, smells, and so on.

original: mi ring ba ni zhes pa ni chos nyid kyi tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ring ba ni zhes pa ni chos nyid kyi tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not long” is because the measure of reality is immeasurable.

original: de bzhin ring zhes pa ni chos nyid kyi rang bzhin mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin ring zhes pa ni chos nyid kyi rang bzhin mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Likewise long” is because the nature of reality is limitless.

original: sems kyi de kho na nyid kyis rdzu 'phrul dngos med 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi de kho na nyid kyis rdzu 'phrul dngos med 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “How is the magic of the reality of mind accomplished without substance?”

original: yod med dbus kyi sems de kho na nyid kyis rdzu 'phrul dngos su snang ba rang bzhin dngos po med pa 'grub par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod med dbus kyi sems de kho na nyid kyis rdzu 'phrul dngos su snang ba rang bzhin dngos po med pa 'grub par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The reality of the mind in the middle between existence and nonexistence is the accomplishment of the magic that appears as substance, which is the nature that is not a thing. This is the meaning.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i sems kyis kyang //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i sems kyis kyang //
translated: Even with a mind that lacks characteristics,

original: zhes pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the emptiness of the general characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid thams cad dpyad par bya //
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad dpyad par bya //
translated: all characteristics should be analyzed.

original: zhes pa ni rang bzhin rang gi mtshan nyid bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang bzhin rang gi mtshan nyid bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nature of the individual characteristics of the essence of a pot, a cloth, and so on,

original: da ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin sems kyis ji ltar bsgom zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin sems kyis ji ltar bsgom zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Now, if one asks, “How does the mind meditate on such a nature?”

original: dngos med bsgom pa'i dngos po yis //
analyzed: dngos med bsgom pa'i dngos po yis //
translated: The substance of the meditation on the absence of substance

original: bsgom pa de ni dpyad par bya //
analyzed: bsgom pa de ni dpyad par bya //
translated: That meditation should be investigated.

original: zhes pa ni don dam @50b pa'i bden pas ni med la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni don dam @50b pa'i bden pas ni med la /
translated: This means that it is not by the ultimate truth,

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i sgo nas ni bsgom par dpyad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i sgo nas ni bsgom par dpyad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: but by the door of the conventional truth that it should be investigated.

original: ji ltar dpyad par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dpyad par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How should it be investigated? It is stated:

original: gzugs dang stong pa'i dbus su ni //
analyzed: gzugs dang stong pa'i dbus su ni //
translated: In the middle between form and emptiness,

original: sems ni mkhas par bya ba ste //
analyzed: sems ni mkhas par bya ba ste //
translated: the mind should be made skilled.

original: zhes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las 'byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa yod par dmigs pa dang rang bzhin gyis 'du byed pa'i chos stong pa nyid du med pa de gnyis dbus yod med kyi sems ni mkhas pa rnal 'byor pas dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las 'byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa yod par dmigs pa dang rang bzhin gyis 'du byed pa'i chos stong pa nyid du med pa de gnyis dbus yod med kyi sems ni mkhas pa rnal 'byor pas dpyad par bya'o //
translated: This means that the skilled yogi should investigate the mind in the middle between the two, the perception of the existence of form and so forth arising from dependent origination and the emptiness of the nature of conditioned phenomena.

original: da ni de ltar dmigs pa can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i yon tan gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni de ltar dmigs pa can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i yon tan gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the qualities of the yogi who has such an object are stated:

original: thams cad kun du dmigs pa yis//
analyzed: thams cad kun du dmigs pa yis//
translated: By the universal perception of all,

original: rnal 'byor lus la nad med 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor lus la nad med 'gyur //
translated: the yogi's body becomes free from illness.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that

original: de la rnal 'byor pas bsgoms na srid pa'i skyon chad pa dang dngos po'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor pas bsgoms na srid pa'i skyon chad pa dang dngos po'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: If the yogi meditates on that, the faults of existence and the faults of entities will not occur.

original: yang sems kyi yon tan brjod 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang sems kyi yon tan brjod 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, wishing to express the qualities of the mind, it is said:

original: gsang ba'i gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The secret of secrets, and so on.

original: de la gsang ba'i gsang ba ni brjod du mi lang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gsang ba'i gsang ba ni brjod du mi lang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, the secret of secrets is because it is inexpressible.

original: gsang chen zhes pa ni spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang chen zhes pa ni spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great secret is because it is beyond the field of experience.

original: rnam shes ye shes gsal ba dang // zhes pa ni mtshan nyid dang / mtshan ma las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam shes ye shes gsal ba dang // zhes pa ni mtshan nyid dang / mtshan ma las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The clear light of consciousness and gnosis is because it is beyond characteristics and signs.

original: de 'dra'i de kho na nyid kyi sems ni bla ma'i lung kho nas thob ces gsungs pa /
analyzed: de 'dra'i de kho na nyid kyi sems ni bla ma'i lung kho nas thob ces gsungs pa /
translated: That suchness of the mind is obtained only through the guru's transmission.

original: gtsug lag klog ba'i gsang ba las //
analyzed: gtsug lag klog ba'i gsang ba las //
translated: It is said: From the secret of reading the scriptures,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: de ltar sems kyi tshad ma rgyas par bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar sems kyi tshad ma rgyas par bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the valid cognition of the mind in detail,

original: phyag rgya tshad ma rgyas par ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya tshad ma rgyas par ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: wishing to teach the valid cognition of the seal in detail, it is said:

original: mnyam pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i lus //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i lus //
translated: The body endowed with the equal mind,🔽and so on.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus it is.

original: de la / lag gnyis gsang ba'i steng du gzhag / ces pa ni sems dpa'i skyil mo krung bcas pa'i rnal 'byor pas ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya spang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //🔽dbugs ni lte ba'i drung bar ro //
analyzed: de la / lag gnyis gsang ba'i steng du gzhag / ces pa ni sems dpa'i skyil mo krung bcas pa'i rnal 'byor pas ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya spang bar bya'o zhes pa'o // dbugs ni lte ba'i drung bar ro //
translated: As for the two hands are placed on the secret, the yogin who has assumed the sattva-paryanka should abandon the samadhi-mudra.

original: zhes pa ni dang la bum pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom mo zhes pa'o //🔽dkyil 'khor tshul du sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dang la bum pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom mo zhes pa'o // dkyil 'khor tshul du sbyar bar bya //
translated: The breath is in the vicinity of the navel means that one should cultivate the vase samadhi.

original: zhes pa ni dgu ba dang dgye ba med par dpung pa bkyed nas zlum por 'jug par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dgu ba dang dgye ba med par dpung pa bkyed nas zlum por 'jug par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should apply in the manner of the mandala means that one should inhale in a circle, expanding the arms without exhalation and inhalation.

original: gzhan ni sbyor ba'i gdan le'u bzhi pa la bshad zin pas ma 'brel to //
analyzed: gzhan ni sbyor ba'i gdan le'u bzhi pa la bshad zin pas ma 'brel to //
translated: The other [lines] have been explained in the fourth chapter of the Yogasara, so they are not connected here.

original: da ni bsgom pa de kho na'i 'phro tshad ma'i gtor ma rgyas par ston 'dod pas gsungs pa /🔽bdud rtsi gtor mas tshim pa'i lus //
analyzed: da ni bsgom pa de kho na'i 'phro tshad ma'i gtor ma rgyas par ston 'dod pas gsungs pa / bdud rtsi gtor mas tshim pa'i lus //
translated: Now, desiring to teach the extensive bali of the measure of the continuity of that meditation, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The body is satisfied by the bali of nectar, and so on.

original: de la kha dog ser po zhes pa la sogs pa ni bdud rtsis @51a * //
analyzed: de la kha dog ser po zhes pa la sogs pa ni bdud rtsis @51a * //
translated: There, the color is yellow and so on refers to the nectar.

original: tshim pa'i mdun du yig 'bru bkod pa'o //
analyzed: tshim pa'i mdun du yig 'bru bkod pa'o //
translated: The seed syllable is placed in front of Tārā.

original: ksha gnyis 'gyur yi ge ni //
analyzed: ksha gnyis 'gyur yi ge ni //
translated: The two KṢA syllables are the seed syllables

original: zhes pa ni me'i rang bzhin kshum ser po ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni me'i rang bzhin kshum ser po ste /
translated: of the nature of fire, the yellow KṢUṀ,

original: ka dang la brtsegs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ka dang la brtsegs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stacked with KA and LA.
